purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of resources required to achieve a specified objective.
purpose.note: A resource requirement that is satisfied by a identifiable resource is represented as .
A resource requirement that is satisfied by a requirement is represented as .
A resource requirement that is satisfied by a reference to some other kind of item is represented as .
purpose.example: A spare part with part number "KSB 1234" is a identifiable resource - .
The replaceble unit with part number "F1234-123456" and serial number "123-456" is a identifiable resource - .
A person with social security number "501022-2345" is a identifiable resource - .
The need for 240 V power supply is a requirement specification - .
purpose.p: Resource requirements may have the following characteristics:

ul.li: A resource requirement can be identified;
A resource requirement can be quantified;
A resource requirement or resource requirement grouping can be classified.

purpose.p: The following are not provided by this module alone but are provided by modules that use this module:

ul.li: Property, date and descriptive representation assignment;
Recording of the organizations or people in organizations who identify an item as satisfying a resource requirement;

purpose.note:
A required resource may be assigned an identifier using the required_resource_identification_item in the
Required resource characterized module.

A required resource or a required resource relationship may be assigned a dated effectivity using the required_resource_effectivity_item in the
Required resource characterized module.
purpose.p: The second edition of this part of ISO 10303 incorporated the modifications to the first edition listed below.
The following ARM EXPRESS declarations and interface specifications have been added:

ul.li: ENTITY Required_resource_by_reference SUBTYPE OF (Required_resource); item : resource_item_select; END_ENTITY;
ENTITY Required_resource_requirement; item : resource_requirement_select; resource_requirement : Required_resource_by_requirement; END_ENTITY;
ENTITY Requirement_version SUBTYPE OF (Product_version); SELF\Product_version.of_product : Requirement; END_ENTITY;
TYPE resource_item_select = EXTENSIBLE GENERIC_ENTITY SELECT; END_TYPE;

purpose.p: The following ARM EXPRESS declarations and interface specifications have been removed:
In addition, modifications have been made to the mapping specification, the MIM schema and the EXPRESS-G diagrams to reflect and be consistent with the modifications of the ARM.

inscope.li: the specification of an actual items or type of item as required resources;
the specification of classifications of required resources;
the specification of the required quantity of a resource;

outscope.li: the identification and detailed descriptions of required resources;
the recording of used or consumed resources.

uof.name: Required_resource
uof.description: The Required_resource UoF lists the resources required to achieve a specified objectice. The UoF provides both resource specification and resource identification capabilities.
